Shooting: Aimed.tooltip: Using sights/scope at long range also requires you to know your ammunition and account for target movement, wind speed etc.

Indirect Fire.tooltip: Expertise: Forward Observer, M41 Pulse Rifle, M790 Grenade Launcher, Mortar, Artillery

Shoulder-launched.tooltip: Expertise: M5 RPG, M83 SADAR, M78 PIG, SIM-118

Missile Weapons.tooltip:
This skill is mainly for launching missiles from a vehicle/starship.
Expertise: SIM-118, M112 HIMAT, ASAT, ABM, AAM, ASM, SAM

Heavy Cannon.tooltip:
Direct fire with a cannon heavier than a HMG, mounted on a vehicle or building.
Expertise: Ballistic, Laser, Railgun, Particle Beam, Plasma

Close Combat: Standup.tooltip: Any kind of striking, kicking or using a melee weapon.

Close Combat: Grappling.tooltip: Wrestling and fighting on the ground.

Swimming.tooltip:
At skill level 2 you can stay afloat in calm water
(DL 2) without any dice rolls.

Sleight of Hand.tooltip: Combined roll with any Tools skill to complete work faster.

Driving.tooltip:
Expertise on a vehicle and Driving >0
means you have a drivers license for it.

Pilot: Space.tooltip:
Space flight including docking and landing.
Expertises: Docking, Starships and space-capable aircraft

Utility Equipment.tooltip:
A key skill for many workers in space ports or colonies. Most equipment of this type is not mobile or has very limited mobility under own power. Example: Excavators, cranes, bulldozers, airlock umbilicals or industrial machinery.
Expertise: Bridge Laying, Crane, Docking, Engineering machinery, Excavator, Powerloader

Comtech.tooltip: Expertise: Radio, EW, Morse, Tightbeam, FTL Communication

Computer Systems.tooltip:
Knowing your way around a computer terminal.
Expertise: Interface 2037, USCM Interface, USN Interface,
Programming, Hacking, AI, Autodoc, Engineering machinery

Electronic Tools.tooltip:
Tools for working with electronic components and wiring.
Cybernetics, Electricity, Hotwiring, Lockpicking

Mechanic Tools.tooltip:
Skill with common tools found in a workshop.
Expertise: Chainsaw, Power Tools, Lockpicking,
Carpentry, Ordnance, Weaponsmith, Hotwiring

Sensor Systems.tooltip:
Using various sensors and reading their output right.
Expertise: Covert Sensors, IR, Lidar, Motion Tracker,
Photography, PUPS, Radar, Sensor Networking, X-ray

Space Crew.tooltip:
Basic crew role on a spaceship or station.
Expertise: Starship, Damage Control, Cooling Systems, Docking, Starship
Identification, Environmental Suit, Life Support

Camouflage.tooltip: Hiding from plain sight and sensors.

CBRN Warfare.tooltip:
Chemical/Biological/Radiological/Nuclear warfare.
Expertise: CBRN Treatment, Environmental Suit, Nuclear Bomb

Intelligence.tooltip:
Intel gathering, analysis and use of "spy" equipment.
Expertise: Covert Sensors, Forgery, Interrogation,
Photography, Sensor Networking, Shadowing,
Starship Identification, Vehicle Identification

Mine Warfare.tooltip:
Used to operate land mines (Anti-Personnell and Anti-Tank) but also to place them well or identify and remove them.
Expertise: IED, Mines AP, Mines AT, Ordnance, Sensor Networking, USCM Interface

Soldiering.tooltip:
Anything a soldier "should" know not covered by a separate skill.
Expertise: Drill, Forward Observer, FAC, Infantry Tactics,
Mobile Tactics, RTI Vehicle Identification

Colonist.tooltip:
General skill to deal with any technical systems or minor repairs in a colony complex not already covered by a specific skill.
Expertise: Cooling Systems, Environmental Suit, Life Support

First Aid.tooltip:
Initial treatment. Advanced treatment requires the Medical skill.
Expertise: IV, Surgery, Toxicology, Infections,
Dive Medicine, Aerospace Medicine, Altitude Medicine
Cold climate, Hot climate, CBRN Treatment, Autodoc

Navigation.tooltip:
General sense of direction in your surroundings and using navigation/astrogation tools. Aboard a ship the starship expertise is used to find your way through corridors.. or ventilation ducts.
Expertise: Orienteering, Interplanetary, Interstellar, Nautical Charts, Starship

Outdoorsman.tooltip:
The current terrain should always be considered an additional required expertise.
Expertise: Bushcrafting, Chainsaw, Evasion, Field Cooking, Fishing, Herbalism, Hunting, Rope Work, Skiing, Tracking, Trapping, Terrain

Streetwise.tooltip:
Dealing with civilians, pick up the local "vibe", gather information in populated areas and quicker find your way around. You may use it instead of Navigation to find your way through a city.
Expertise: Interrogation, Language, Shadowing

Artistry.tooltip: Expertise: Forgery, Music, Painting, Singing, Performance, Writing

Medical.tooltip:
Profession skill of doctors and nurses.
Expertise: Aerospace Medicine, Autodoc, CBRN Treatment, Cryogenics, Cybernetics, Dissection, Dive Medicine, Herbalism, Infections, IV, Surgery, Toxicology, X-ray.

Shuttle.tooltip: Unarmed shuttle sized aerospace craft from a small EEV up to a CS-14 Briaeros

Gliderplane.tooltip: Engineless aircraft or parafoil. May be used with Pilot or Parachute skills.

Cargo Platform.tooltip: Flying cargo platforms like the WY-37B Cargo Lifter Sled.

AD-19 Bearcat.tooltip: VTOL strikeship which can perform recon/CAS/medevac missions.

EVAC-3.tooltip: Aerospace fighter for escort or air/orbital superiority missions.

PUPS.tooltip: Advanced antigrav spectrograh drone. Used with Sensor Systems skill as they are largely automated. For direct control use Remote Piloting. Restricted WY technology not available in normal military training.

M57 APC.tooltip: Light APC that comes in variants with different armament like dual 20mm HMG:s, plasma/laser cannons or a mortar. The M577 is the main vehicle used by colonial marines.

M292 Artillery.tooltip:
Firing it is done with the Indirect Fire skill
and requires the Artillery weapon expertise.

XT-37 Stinger.tooltip: Light off-road attack vehicle capable of being airdropped.

CRRC.tooltip:
Combat Rubber Reconnaissance Craft.
Often used by marines and special forces.

Motorboat.tooltip:
Motor powered solid hull boats up to class 3
(which would include coastal Fast Attack Crafts, FAC:s).

Sailing.tooltip: Any boat or larger ship as long as it is mainly sail-powered.

M41 Pulse Rifle.tooltip:
Also covers the built-in U1 grenade launcher
and variants like the M41AE2 AR.

VP55 LR Pistol.tooltip: Low-recoil pistol specialized for use aboard spacecraft.

Artillery.tooltip: Any type of field artillery firing shells of 120mm+. Uses Indirect Fire.

Dartgun.tooltip: Fires darts - which could contain for example a sedative to capture animals.

Flamer.tooltip: Carbine-format or vehicle mounted flamethrowers. Uses Shooting: Auto.

Harpoon.tooltip: Harpoon grappling device used in space or underwater harpoon gun.

Mortar.tooltip: Allows firing any type of basic mortar, portable or vehicle-mounted. Uses Indirect Fire.

Pistol.tooltip: Any model of basic pistol or revolver.

Shotgun.tooltip: To hunt smaller animals or birds, but can also be a potent short range combat weapon. Shells can contain shot in different sizes depending on the intended target. Uses Shooting: Dynamic.

F44AA Pulse Rifle.tooltip: Old experimental PR with aim assist that predated the M41 & M56 designs.

Harrington AR.tooltip:
Older precursor to the US pulse rifle that has now
been phased out of active use.

Weyland Storm Rifle.tooltip: Older assault rifle model manufactured by Weyland Corp.

X-9 AR.tooltip: Older model that is actually a carbine since there is no built-in grenade launcher.

HMG.tooltip:
Heavy Machine Gun up to 30mm, anything bigger counts
as cannon. Uses Shooting: Auto.

Ballistic.tooltip:
Ballistic cannons like the ones mounted on an
Infantry Fighting Vehicle (IFV) or Main Battle Tank (MBT).

Particle Beam.tooltip: Good at destroying electronics, mounted on vehicles or starships.

Plasma.tooltip:
Represents general training on plasma technology
applicable both for mounted weapons or other uses like welding.

M112 HIMAT.tooltip: Portable anti-tank missile system used by infantry squads. Uses Missile skill.

M790 Grenade Launcher.tooltip:
Handheld launcher for 40mm grenades, very simple but
effective design. Uses Indirect Fire.

SIM-118.tooltip: Manpad anti-air missile. Uses Missile Weapons or Shoulder-launched.

AAM.tooltip:
Air-air missile like the AIM-90E Headlock.
Fired from an aircraft against other aircraft.

ABM.tooltip: Anti-ballistic missile. Intended to intercept another projectile in space or atmosphere.

ASAT.tooltip: Anti-satellite missile. Fired against targets in orbit or deep space.

ASM.tooltip: Air-surface missile. Also applies for orbit-surface. Includes dropship armament like the AGM-220C, Mk.88 SGW, Mk.10 ZEUS and Banshee 70.

SAM.tooltip:
Surface-air missile like the LIM-417 Phalanx 
primarily used by colonial marine forces.

Baton.tooltip:
Baton fighting technique typically taught to police 
or security guards. Also applicable to tonfa, tire iron or a 
short metal pipe (but not a baseball bat).

Bayonet.tooltip: Part of basic infantry training since ancient times and provides a Close Combat: Standup bonus with a bayonet mounted on your weapon.

Handcuffs.tooltip: Techniques to secure an unwilling target with handcuffs or zip-ties.

Knife.tooltip: From improvised shank to specialized combat or throwing knifes.

Sword.tooltip:
A machete, katana or the traditional marine corps 
saber all count as sword.

Chainsaw.tooltip: Can be used with Mechanic Tools or Outdoorsman.

Cooling Systems.tooltip: Used for reactors, aboard starships and for different types of industrial machinery. Includes safe handling of cryogenic fluids and fuel.

Crane.tooltip: Operation of large cranes. Used with Utility Equipment.

Damage Control.tooltip: Used with Space Crew or Seamanship.

Electricity.tooltip:
Professional knowledge of electric cabling, power 
generators, batteries and safety near high voltage lines. Used 
with Electronics Tools.

Engineering machinery.tooltip:
Used with Utility Equipment for direct operation, 
Computer Systems for programming them or Engineering for 
creating a new design.

Excavator.tooltip: Digging with a mechanical excavator arm or dozer blade. Holes, trenches or flattening land for building foundations. Used with Utility Equipment.

Hotwiring.tooltip:
Start a vehicle without the key. 
Low-tech vehicles: some know-how and a skill like Sleight of Hand, Criminal or Mechanic Tools. 
Vehicles with better anti-theft protection: more advanced equipment and the Electronic Tools skill.

Hyperbaric.tooltip:
Work in elevated pressures. Typically used for hull 
work like underwater welding on wet navy ships, but would also 
apply for setting explosive charges in a liquid medium and 
understanding how shockwaves propagate. 
Uses Welding or Demolition.

IED.tooltip:
Improvised Explosive Device. Knowledge how to create 
improvised mines or explosive charges. Used with Demolition or 
Mine Warfare.

Lockpicking.tooltip:
Low-tech locks may be possible to defeat with a pin 
and the Sleight of Hand or Criminal skill. More advanced locks 
require Mechanic Tools or Electronics Tools skills to run a 
bypass.

Power Tools.tooltip:
Hand-held powered tools like saws, hammer-drills, 
grinders etc. Does not include chainsaw which is a separate 
expertise. Uses Mechanic Tools.

Weaponsmith.tooltip:
Allows you to modify firearms or create crude ones 
given the right tools and materials. Uses Mechanic Tools skill.

Drill.tooltip:
Wear a dress uniform correctly, march in formation, 
perform formal drills and ceremonies. 
Uses Soldiering or Space Crew.

FAC.tooltip:
Forward Air Controller. To call in and direct close 
air support (CAS) or missiles. Includes using target marking 
equipment for laser guidance. Uses the Soldiering skill.

Forced Entry.tooltip:
Kick in doors, break them with a ram or budge the 
frame with a crowbar for a quick entry. Also applies to windows 
or other entrances (if there is no atmosphere you need Hull 
breaching). Usable with Criminal, Policework, Strength or 
Demolition (if using explosives).

Forward Observer.tooltip:
To call in and adjust artillery fire. 
Uses Indirect Fire or Soldiering skill. If using a drone to observe it will be 
a combined roll with Remote Piloting.

Hull breaching.tooltip:
How to forcibly breach through a ships hull to allow 
entrance. Usable with Demolition or Welding skill, the latter 
will likely also require plasma expertise.

Infantry Tactics.tooltip:
Small unit tactics during combat or movement. 
Used with Soldiering.

Interrogation.tooltip:
Used with Policework, Intelligence, Intimidation,
Streetwise or Charisma depending on situation.

Maritime Tactics.tooltip: Wet navy tactics, on or below the surface. Used with Seamanship.

Mines AP.tooltip: Anti-personnell mines like the claymore or bounding variants. Training in setting them, but also applies to disposal. Disarming an unknown (not placed by you) mine while keeping it intact also requires Ordnance. Used with Mine Warfare.

Mines AT.tooltip: Anti-vehicle mines buried or off-route variants. Training in setting them, but also applies to disposal. Disarming an unknown (not placed by you) mine while keeping it intact also requires Ordnance. Used with Mine Warfare.

Mobile Tactics.tooltip: Mobile and armoured warfare. Includes vehicle combat and how to operate tactically during traveling and escort duty. Used with Soldiering or Driving.

Nuclear Bomb.tooltip:
Handle nuclear explosive devices.
Used with CBRN Warfare or Demolition.

Ordnance.tooltip:
Used with Utility Equipment to rearm a dropship,
with Mechanic Tools to safely cut a shell open or
with Mine Warfare to dismantle a mine into components.

Parachute wings.tooltip: Training badge for completing basic Parachute training.

RTI.tooltip:
Resistance to interrogation training.
Provides bonus to Psy or Tou to resist interrogation and torture.
Can also be used with Soldiering or Criminal

Space Tactics.tooltip:
Tactics for ship combat in deep space or orbit.
Used with Starship Bridge or for smaller ships with Space Crew.

Starship Identification.tooltip: Used with Space Crew or Starship Bridge.

Covert Sensors.tooltip:
Used with Intelligence or Sensor Systems.
Camouflage may be used for hiding them.

EW.tooltip: Electronic Warfare. Used with the Comtech skill.

Interface 2037.tooltip:
Basic reliable interface to the main computer/AI
used on many civilian starships.

IR.tooltip:
Uses Sensor Systems skill. Can use Perception for
personal equipment like night vision goggles.

Lidar.tooltip: Pulsed laser to measure and map objects. Uses Sensor Systems skill.

Radar.tooltip: Used with Sensor Systems skill. Also Artillery for counter-battery.

Radio.tooltip: Know how to work with common radios. Uses Comtech skill.

Tightbeam.tooltip:
Operation of tightbeam communication systems which 
will typically use lasers. Uses Comtech skill.

USCM Interface.tooltip: Used with Computer Systems. Used with Mine Warfare for the UA571 Sentry Gun.

Butchering.tooltip: You can skin and butcher animals and fillet fish. Used with Cooking or Sleight of Hand.

Evasion.tooltip: Techniques to hide tracks while moving through terrain and strategies to confuse pursuers, dogs or sensors. Also requires terrain expertise. Used with Outdoorsman or Camouflage.

Field Cooking.tooltip: You can prepare meals using open fire or a field stove and given just something to work with turn a standard issue MRE into something edible. Food always taste better in the field. Used with Cooking or Outdoorsman.

Herbalism.tooltip:
Knowledge of plants with medicinal effects. To find 
such plants the current terrain is also a required expertise. 
Used with Outdoorsman or Medical skill.

Hunting.tooltip:
You know where to find game, how to get close and how to process & skin them after the shot. Used with Outdoorsman 
and terrain expertise.

K9.tooltip:
You have specialist K9 training to work with dogs for 
for searching, guarding etc. Your squad will benefit from the 
senses of your dog for detection purposes (combined roll using 
dog perception + your Animal Handling which in practice means 
your skill is used since it will be lower).

Skiing.tooltip: You can ski and also had training on how to work as a squad to bring a sled with you. Used with Outdoorsman or Dexterity.

Tracking.tooltip:
Read tracks to uncover the story they tell, in what 
direction, how many, how fast they were moving etc. Used with 
Outdoorsman. If tracking a vehicle and you also have Vehicle 
Identification it allows you to identify the model instead of 
only the general type as wheeled, tracked.

Trapping.tooltip: Used with Outdoorsman and terrain expertise.

Orienteering.tooltip: Provides bonus to navigation over land regardless of terrain.

Androids.tooltip: Knowledge of common android models, their capabilities and how to service them including basic procedures like rebooting or installing a module chip. Service and simpler repairs like fluid refill use Mechanic Tools. Diagnostics use Computer Systems.

Autodoc.tooltip: Usable with Computer Systems, First Aid or Medical.

CBRN Treatment.tooltip: Usable with CBRN Warfare, First Aid or Medical.

Cryogenics.tooltip: Maintenance & repair of hypersleep pods including safe handling of cryogenic fluids and fuel.

Cybernetics.tooltip: Installation or repair of cybernetic implants (this may also require Surgery). Used with Medical. Some repairs like fixing EMP damage in limbs are also possible with Electronic Tools. Also covers basic procedures for common android models like rebooting or installing a module chip.

Dissection.tooltip: Performed on a dead body to for example determine the cause of death or on a plant to study how it functions. Used with Medical or an appropriate Science skill.

Forensics.tooltip: Used with Policework or Science Equipment skills.

Laboratory equipment.tooltip: Qualifies you to assist someone who actually knows what they are doing in a lab.

Surgery.tooltip:
If performed with First Aid it is limited to "Field 
Surgery" field surgery procedures, e.g. needle decompression.

Toxicology.tooltip:
Usable with First Aid, Medical or for identifying 
natural poisons Outdoorsman.

Veterinary.tooltip: Used with Animal Handling or Medical.

X-ray.tooltip: Mainly used for medical purposes but the expertise would also cover for example space weaponry using the technology. Used with Medical or Sensor Systems skill for X-ray scans.

English.tooltip: Main language for the US, 3WE and many major corporations like Weyland-Yutani.

French.tooltip: Required for the French Foreign Legion.

Japanese.tooltip: Used within 3WE, Weyland-Yutani and several other corporations.

Russian.tooltip: Major language in the UPP countries.

Spanish.tooltip: Second largest language in the US. Several colony worlds are mainly spanish-speaking.

Music.tooltip: You can read notes and compose music.

Party Tricks.tooltip: Small "magic" tricks or more risky ones like the "knife thing". Used with Sleight of Hand.

Performance.tooltip: You are a trained actor and can believably portray different emotions or personalities.

Photography.tooltip: You know how to properly use a camera or a video camera, for artistic or documentation purposes. Used with Artistry, Sensor Systems or Intelligence.

Singing.tooltip: Being a trained singer lets you control your voice and hit specific notes.

Guitar.tooltip: Uses Artistry or Sleight of Hand skill

Keyboard.tooltip: Uses Artistry or Sleight of Hand skill

Acrobatics.tooltip:
Provides bonus when jumping, balancing or falling and 
allows you to do maneuvers that would be impossible without 
training, like a free handstand. Used with Dexterity.

Barista.tooltip: You are skilled at making coffee and coffee-based drinks which can be a morale booster in many situations. Used with Cooking.

Card Cheating.tooltip: Used with Gambling or Sleight of Hand.

Docking.tooltip: Docking procedures for starships, umbilicals or land based airlocks. Also allows you to perform manual overrides similar as if you had Lockpicking. Used with Pilot: Space for ships, Space Crew for manual operation or Utility Equipment for umbilicals.

Environmental Suit.tooltip: Training on suits for extreme environments like space, biohazard or high-pressure. Advanced accessories/tools require separate expertise. Used with Zero-G, CBRN Warfare, Space Crew or Colonist.

Forgery.tooltip:
Used with Criminal or Intelligence, Computer Systems 
for digital forgeries or Artistry for valuable objects.

Pickpocketing.tooltip: Used with Sleight of Hand vs Perception.

Powerloader.tooltip:
Exoskeleton powerloader Class II license. 
Used with Utility Equipment.

Law.tooltip: Usable with Policework for criminal law, Commerce for trade laws. Officers may use it with Soldiering for military law.

Life Support.tooltip:
Space Crew or Colonist to operate and maintain. 
Mechanic or Electronics Tools for more extensive repairs or 
modifications.

Rope Work.tooltip:
Used with Seamanship, Sleight of Hand or Outdoorsman 
to tie knots or make rope ladders. With Dexterity for 
rappelling. With Animal Handling to improvise a harness & leash.

Scaling.tooltip:
Trained to use professional climbing equipment. 
Used with Dexterity.

Shadowing.tooltip:
Opposed roll vs targets Streetwise. 
Used with Intelligence, Policework, Streetwise or 
Remote Piloting (if using a drone).

Thrusterpack.tooltip: Operate spacesuit thrusters with the Zero-G skill.

ARM Sympathizer.tooltip: Req: Not Live long and prosper

Bloodthirst.tooltip: Req: Not Religious, Not Righteous, Not Soft hearted

Jarhead.tooltip: Req: Max Rank Lance Corporal (E3), Not Quick Learner

Live long and prosper.tooltip: Req: Not ARM Sympathizer, Not Bloodthirst

Private who?.tooltip:
Req: Max rank Private FC (E2), Cha <4,
Not Canary, Not Impressive stature, Not Tacticool

Small frame.tooltip: Req: Background, Not Impressive stature, Not Strategic reserves

Strategic reserves.tooltip: Req: End <4, Not Tunnel Rat, Not Small frame

Access to the files.tooltip:
Req: Computer Systems (USCM Interface) 4, 
Not Watched, either Staff Sergeant (E6) or Hacking,

Attractive.tooltip: Req: Charisma 4, Not Bad Aura, Not Bad Hygiene

Catnapper.tooltip:
Req: Soldiering 3, Not Alert,
Not Nightmares, Not Maintenance Fanatic

Cautious.tooltip:
Req: Not Jinxed, not Dapper Sapper, 
not any trait titled "Reckless".

Combat Drop Wings.tooltip:
+1 bonus to Parachute and 1 Glory.
Parachute Wings and one combat drop (parachute, glider or pod)

Draw Stranger.tooltip: Req: Background, Any Pistol expertise, Terrain: Desert

Drill Instructor.tooltip:
Req: Sergeant (E5), Soldiering 4, Drill, 
Not Whisper-voiced

EOD Expert.tooltip:
Explosive Ordnance Disposal. Someone got to do it and you have the proper training. +1 on detecting and disposing mines and IED:s. +1 Stealth when sneaking past a motion sensor by moving extremely slow.
Req: IED, Mines AP, Mines AT, Ordnance.

Escape Artist.tooltip: Req: Sleight of Hand 3, Lockpicking, Rope Work

Eye of the Tiger.tooltip:
Ignore first stun each combat
Req: Toughness 4, 
Not Glass Joe, Not I'm gonna die!!!

Farmer Family.tooltip: Req: Background, Terrain: Temperate or Desert

Fixer.tooltip: Req: Charisma 3, Not Loner, Not Mean Bastard

Gun Nut.tooltip:
Req: Expertise for 3 different small arms 
(using Shooting skill).

Gung Ho.tooltip: Req: Not Cautious, Not Combat Shakes, Not Sleepyhead

Impressive Stature.tooltip:
Req: Str 4, Tou 4, Not Ninja, Not Private who?, 
Not Small frame, Not Victim

I've been through worse.tooltip: Req: Purple Heart, Not I'm gonna die!!!

Ninja.tooltip:
Req: Close Combat (Standup) 3, Throwing 3, 
Not Fear of the dark, Not Impressive Stature

Quick Learner.tooltip: Req: Charisma 3, Not Jarhead, Not Thick-skulled

Shellback.tooltip: Req: 10 missions, Space Crew 4, Terrain: Space

Spacer.tooltip: Req: Background, Space Crew 1, Terrain: Space

Spotter.tooltip: Req: Shooting: Aimed 3, Soldiering 2, Any sniper/scoped rifle expertise

Squad Leader.tooltip:
Made Lance Corporal (E3) at boot camp.
Req: Background, Cha 3, Infantry Tactics, Not Scapegoat

Stiff upper lip.tooltip:
Req: Corporal (E4), Not life of the party, 
Not Bad Hygiene

The Big Five.tooltip: Req: You must have met all five during missions

Thick-skulled.tooltip: Req: Psyche < 3, Not Glass Joe, Not Quick Learner

Tough.tooltip: Get one more box in your Health bar

Tunnel Rat.tooltip:
Take no stress from enclosed spaces.
Req: Background, Dex 3, Str < 4, Not Strategic reserves

Trusted Leader.tooltip:
Req: Sergeant (E5), Psyche 3, Soldiering 3, 
Infantry Tactics

All out of bubble gum.tooltip:
Req: Not Private who?, Not Impressive Stature, 
Not Victim

Bad aura.tooltip:
Req: Not Attractive, Not Life of the party, 
Not Private who?

I'm gonna die!!!.tooltip:
Req: Background, Not Gung Ho, Not Tough, 
Not Just a flesh wound

Mean Bastard.tooltip:
Intimidation 2, Not Fixer, Not Whipped, 
Not Soft hearted, Not Life of the party, Not Victim

Scapegoat.tooltip: Req: Background, Not Righteous, Not Squad Leader

Sleepyhead.tooltip: Req: Not Alert, Not Gung Ho, Not Rise and shine

Soft hearted.tooltip: Req: Not Bloodthirst, Not Mean Bastard, Not Killer

Victim.tooltip: Req: Str < 4, Cha < 4, Not Mean Bastard

Watched.tooltip: Req: Can not be chosen, given out by the GM if appropriate

Whisper-voiced.tooltip: Req: Not Life of the party, Not Mean Bastard, Not Drill Instructor

Loner.tooltip: Req: Not Fixer, Not Monophobia, Not Life of the party, Not Neon Tan

Left arm.tooltip: Installation or repair of cybernetic implants (this may also require Surgery). Used with Medical. Some repairs like fixing EMP damage are also possible with Electronic Tools. Also covers basic procedures for common android models like rebooting or installing a module chip.

Gun Hand.tooltip:
Illegal and impossible to get via normally available surgery.
Req: Cybernetic Hand/Arm
